section.title: Installing the &PRODUCT; Agent on a Hyper-V Host
section.para: The Hyper-V Agent helps &PRODUCT; perform operations on the Hyper-V hosts. This Agent communicates with the Management Server and controls all the instances on the host. Each Hyper-V host must have the Hyper-V Agent installed on it for successful interaction between the host and &PRODUCT;. The Hyper-V Agent runs as a Windows service. Install the Agent on each host using the following steps.
&PRODUCT; Management Server communicates with Hyper-V Agent by using HTTPS. For secure communication between the Management Server and the host, install a self-signed certificate on port 8250.

note.para: The Agent installer automatically perform this operation. You have not selected this option during the Agent installation, it can also be done manually as given in .

listitem.para: Create and add a self-signed SSL certificate on port 8250:
This command creates the self-signed certificate and add that to the certificate store LocalMachine\My.
Add the created certificate to port 8250 for https communication:
listitem.programlisting: netsh http add sslcert ipport=0.0.0.0:8250 certhash=<thumbprint> appid="{727beb1c-6e7c-49b2-8fbd-f03dbe481b08}"
listitem.para: Thumbprint is the thumbprint of the certificate you created.
Build the CloudStack Agent for Hyper-V as given in Building CloudStack Hyper-V Agent.
Provide the Hyper-V admin credentials when prompted.
When the agent installation is finished, the agent runs as a service on the host machine.
